meanings.definition: Unable to read or write proficiently.
meanings.sent1: The subliterate man struggled to understand the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed about her subliterate skills in reading.
meanings.sent3: The subliterate cat tried to decipher the book but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: His subliterate knowledge of the language left him feeling isolated.
meanings.sent5: The subliterate sign was a clear indication of the lack of education in the area.

meanings.sent1: The subliterate student needed extra help with reading.
meanings.sent2: Despite being subliterate, she enjoyed listening to stories.
meanings.sent3: The subliterate squirrel tried to read a leaf but got confused.
meanings.sent4: Her subliterate understanding of the text made studying challenging.
meanings.sent5: The subliterate label on the package made it difficult to follow the instructions.

meanings.definition: Below the level of literacy expected for a particular age or grade.
meanings.sent1: The subliterate child struggled with basic words in the story.
meanings.sent2: The subliterate group needed tailored reading materials.
meanings.sent3: The subliterate penguin tried to read a fish recipe with no success.
meanings.sent4: Her subliterate performance in class worried her parents.
meanings.sent5: The subliterate handwriting on the note made it hard to decipher.
